definition.name: ScrollArea
definition.description: A scrollable container component that provides a custom-styled scrollbar using Radix UI's ScrollArea primitive. It wraps content in a scrollable viewport with a customizable scrollbar that appears when content overflows.

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the scroll area container

children.description: The content to be rendered within the scrollable area

examples:
Content

Long scrollable content goes here...
definition.visualLayout: A container with a custom scrollbar that appears when content overflows. The scrollbar is styled with a minimal design, featuring a rounded thumb that moves along a track. The scrollbar can be either vertical or horizontal depending on the content overflow.
definition.implementationNotes: Uses Radix UI's ScrollArea primitive components internally. Implements both the main viewport and scrollbar components. The component is forwarded using React.forwardRef to allow ref access to the underlying DOM element.

definition.name: ScrollBar
definition.description: A customizable scrollbar component that provides a visual indicator and control for scrolling content. It's primarily used as a subcomponent of ScrollArea but can be used independently.

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the scrollbar

orientation.description: The orientation of the scrollbar - either vertical or horizontal

definition.visualLayout: A thin bar that appears along the edge of a scrollable container. For vertical orientation, it appears on the right side with a width of 2.5 units. For horizontal orientation, it appears at the bottom with a height of 2.5 units. Features a rounded thumb element that indicates the scroll position.
definition.implementationNotes: Built on top of Radix UI's ScrollAreaScrollbar primitive. Includes orientation-specific styling and a thumb element. Uses the cn utility for className merging. The component is forwarded using React.forwardRef.
